dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6997 IH: Stopping the Fraudulent Sales of Firearms Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Scanlon (for herself, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Dean, and Ms. Norton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to make fraudulent dealings in firearms and ammunition unlawful, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping the Fraudulent Sales of Firearms Act.

subsection.text: Section 922(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (9), by striking the period and at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: to import, manufacture, or sell a firearm or ammunition by means of false or fraudulent pretenses, representations, or promises; and

to transmit or cause to be transmitted, by means of wire, radio, or television communication in interstate or foreign commerce, any communication relating to the importation, manufacture, or sale described in subparagraph (A).

subsection.text: Section 924(a)(1)(B) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting (a)(10), before (f).
